summary: An FBI Miami Division request to the Document Conversion Laboratory (DocLab) for scanning and automation assistance regarding telephone records related to the obstruction of justice case against Alfredo Rodriguez, Jeffrey Epstein's former house manager. The records, from an address book believed to contain contacts of additional underage victims, are to be processed and loaded into the Telephone Application (TA) database for investigative use.

persons.name: Alfredo Rodriguez
persons.role: Former house manager and butler to Jeffrey Epstein; subject of obstruction of justice case
persons.context: The subject of the FBI's obstruction of justice investigation. He allegedly possessed an address book with names and numbers of potential underage victims of Epstein and attempted to sell it rather than comply with subpoenas.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.role: Subject of a child prostitution case
persons.context: Identified as the individual whose former house manager, Alfredo Rodriguez, possessed an address book believed to contain contacts of additional underage victims.

persons.name: William T. Murphy
persons.role: FBI recipient/contact (UC likely meaning Unit Chief)
persons.context: Addressed in the routing of the document to Records Management.

connections.description: Rodriguez was the former house manager and butler to Jeffrey Epstein.
Rodriguez possessed an address book believed to contain information on Epstein's potential underage victims and attempted to sell it, obstructing justice related to Epstein's case.

events.title: FBI opens obstruction case against Rodriguez
events.description: Miami Division opened an obstruction of justice case against Alfredo Rodriguez.

events.title: Timeframe for telephone records review
events.description: Telephone records generated between September 1, 2001, and the present (June 2010) are noted for processing, indicating the scope of the investigative review.

events.title: FBI request for records processing
events.description: The FBI Miami Division formally requests the Document Conversion Laboratory to scan and automate telephone records related to the Rodriguez/Epstein investigation for incorporation into the Telephone Application database.

keyFacts: Alfredo Rodriguez, Epstein's former house manager, was under FBI investigation for obstruction of justice for attempting to sell an address book believed to contain names and numbers of additional, previously unknown underage victims of Jeffrey Epstein.

The FBI was processing telephone records (target number 310-457-9894) from this address book, believed to belong to Epstein, his associates, or potential victims, for incorporation into its centralized Telephone Application (TA) database.
The document reveals an internal FBI process (Baleen Sweep) for scanning, automating, and analyzing large volumes of documentary evidence to support investigations.
The address book and related records were obtained in response to federal subpoenas issued during pending civil litigation against Epstein.
